welcomeSection.title: Welcome
welcomeSection.Presentation:
My name is Aymeric Godivier, and I am a QA Tester and Game Designer.

Curious and eager to acquire diverse skills, I started with a training in multimedia.
Passionate about video games, I decided to pursue this field with an initial training in Level Design, followed by a Master's in Game Design.

To further expand my skillset, I completed a software testing training in 2024 to learn all the methods and tools for testing.
welcomeSection.GD:
I worked as a Game Designer on the puzzle game Terebron.
I also had the opportunity to create numerous games during my studies and during Game Jams.
welcomeSection.QA:
Thanks to my training, I have acquired all the necessary skills for the role of a tester.
I have developed several test strategies, conducted numerous functional and non-functional tests, and also created automated test scripts.

projects.title: Tomsen
projects.description: As part of my training, using a mockup and functional specifications, I designed a test strategy. This included a requirement review, a test plan with test schedules, as well as documentation detailing the strategy itself.

projects.title: Eco Bliss Bath
projects.description: As part of my training, I was responsible for automating all functional tests, as well as API tests and some security tests, using Cypress.

projects.title: Kasa
projects.description: As part of my training, using a Figma mockup and an existing backend, I developed the entire front-end of the site in React.

projects.title: Terebron
projects.description: I wrote most of the technical and design documentation. I designed new mechanics and revamped existing ones. I created over 150 levels, which I integrated and tested in Unity. I redesigned the game interface and designed the level editor.

projects.title: Vault Plunderer
projects.description: I contributed to the overall player progression. I also designed one of the puzzles based on cylinder manipulation and revamped another puzzle that involved repositioning rails.

projects.title: Bisbille
projects.description: I participated in developing the core mechanics of the game. I was responsible for reporting bugs and testing multiple configurations of atomic parameters to ensure good game feel. I was also in charge of supervising the playtests.

projects.title: Alice
projects.description: As a designer, I created several of the mini-games included in the game. I also programmed all the systems and interfaces of the game in Blueprint. Additionally, I integrated the level design into Unreal Engine.

projects.title: Jekyll and Hyde
projects.description: I programmed all the systems and interfaces of the game in Blueprints, including a dialogue system with choices and a moral alignment system. I also integrated all the level design into Unreal Engine.

projects.title: SilverLining
projects.description: I wrote a significant portion of the design documentation. I also designed a large part of the modules that make up the game space. Additionally, I was heavily involved in balancing tests.

projects.title: Hikikomori
projects.description: I co-wrote the dialogues. I designed the assets using Asset Forge, then created all the level design with those assets and integrated them into Unity.

projects.title: The Cost of Living
projects.description: I contributed to the design of the core mechanics, primarily the exchange mechanic and the initial abilities. I designed the first level of the game and integrated all the final assets into Unity.
